info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 7:55PM EDT until June 08 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN GREENE...NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA...NORTHEASTERN WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 755 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cameron, or 14 miles southeast of Moundsville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cameron, Hundred, Aleppo, New Freeport, Rocklick, Lynn Camp, Lone Oak, Glen Easton, Knob Fork, Beelers Station, and Littleton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
